question.questionText: Look at the circuit in the picture. The gap between the D-cell and the switch needs to be connected. Can you use a piece of string to make the connection? Why or why not?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: No, string is an insulator, so the pathway would not be completed.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: No because a string is not made of iron or steel.
It would not work. It would have to be a wire to be able to work because it is not metal.
No, because string is not made of metal and it cannot conduct electricity.
No because it need to be made of metal to conduct electricity.
No because the electricity will not go through the string because it has to be some steel or iron.
Because it will not let electricity through the string.
No it is not metal.
No because a piece of string is not a conductor.
No, because Electricity can only go thorough objects that contain metal.
No, It has to be a wire to connect. The wire has things in it to connect it.
No because string cannot hold the electricity through it.
No because it is not metal and it does not allow electricity to get through.
No. The string is not made of metal.
You cannot because a piece of string is not steel metal or iron so it cannot go through.
You could not do that because the circuit would not make it.
No, because it is made of thread.
No because the string had not metal or iron.
No, it will not work because you have to have some kind of metal to make it work.
No it has to hook up to the D-cell.
You cannot because it is an insulator.
No, because electricity does not flow through string.
It could not because electricity cannot go through sting.
No, because a piece of string does not have electricity in it.
No! You need another wire to connection.
No, because it needs a path of electricity. It would need a wire.
No, because it does not have a wire and it cannot get energy.
No because a piece of string is not something made of wire and cannot carry electricity through that type of material.
No, because it does not have any metal.
Yes and why is that up put in the 2 holes and the you can make electricity.
No, because the electricity cannot flow through the yarn.
No, you cannot. That is because it does not conduct electricity.
No because you need to have a aluminum foil.
You cannot use a piece of string because it has no electricity in it.
No because it is a String.
No because the string is not a wire.
You cannot use a piece of string to make a connection because only aluminum, iron, steel and brass can.
